intro: Terebinthina punctata, commonly known as the spotted terebinth, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a slightly pubescent surface. Terebinthina punctata is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
